channel.title: CVE Feed for webtoffee -- WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels
channel.description: The latest CVEs for webtoffee -- WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels

item.title: CVE-2023-7068|2024-08-02T08:50:07.883Z -- webtoffee -- woocommerce%20pdf%20invoices%2C%20packing%20slips%2C%20delivery%20notes%20and%20shipping%20labels
item.description: The WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on theprint_packinglist action in all versions up to, and including, 4.3.0. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to export orders which can contain sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2024-22288|2024-08-01T22:43:34.466Z -- webtoffee -- woocommerce%20pdf%20invoices%2C%20packing%20slips%2C%20delivery%20notes%20and%20shipping%20labels
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WebToffee WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels allows Reflected XSS.This issue affects WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels: from n/a through 4.4.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-0957|2024-08-01T18:26:28.962Z -- webtoffee -- woocommerce%20pdf%20invoices%2C%20packing%20slips%2C%20delivery%20notes%20and%20shipping%20labels
item.description: The WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Customer Notes field in all versions up to, and including, 4.4.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected invoice for printing.

item.title: CVE-2023-51546|2024-05-17T08:44:58.426Z -- webtoffee -- woocommerce%20pdf%20invoices%2C%20packing%20slips%2C%20delivery%20notes%20and%20shipping%20labels
item.description: Improper Privilege Management vulnerability in WebToffee WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels allows Privilege Escalation.This issue affects WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels: from n/a through 4.2.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-0957|2024-06-04T17:59:20.988Z -- webtoffee -- woocommerce%20pdf%20invoices%2C%20packing%20slips%2C%20delivery%20notes%20and%20shipping%20labels
item.description: The WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Customer Notes field in all versions up to, and including, 4.4.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected invoice for printing.

item.title: CVE-2024-22288|2024-03-27T05:49:44.419Z -- webtoffee -- woocommerce%20pdf%20invoices%2C%20packing%20slips%2C%20delivery%20notes%20and%20shipping%20labels
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WebToffee WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels allows Reflected XSS.This issue affects WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels: from n/a through 4.4.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-3216|2024-04-06T03:24:44.171Z -- webtoffee -- woocommerce%20pdf%20invoices%2C%20packing%20slips%2C%20delivery%20notes%20and%20shipping%20labels
item.description: The WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the wt_pklist_reset_settings() function in all versions up to, and including, 4.4.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to reset all of the plugin's settings.

item.title: CVE-2023-51546|2024-07-25T13:37:10.837Z -- webtoffee -- woocommerce%20pdf%20invoices%2C%20packing%20slips%2C%20delivery%20notes%20and%20shipping%20labels
item.description: Improper Privilege Management vulnerability in WebToffee WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels allows Privilege Escalation.This issue affects WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels: from n/a through 4.2.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-3216|2024-08-01T20:05:08.295Z -- webtoffee -- woocommerce%20pdf%20invoices%2C%20packing%20slips%2C%20delivery%20notes%20and%20shipping%20labels
item.description: The WooCommerce PDF Invoices, Packing Slips, Delivery Notes and Shipping Labels plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the wt_pklist_reset_settings() function in all versions up to, and including, 4.4.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to reset all of the plugin's settings.
